artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Matsui Eikichi; Carver: Takimoto Chokuzan
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 473; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 213, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two sheet configured vertically; red-skinned chubby nude figure clinging onto the back of a very large fish, which is diving down beneath water surface; turtle, LRQ; woman with long flowing hair wearing a white blouse with predominately dark blue pattern and light blue skirt with her PL hand up to her brow, on the rocky shoreline at top
dimension: 14 3/4 × 10 in. (37.47 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban, upright diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 根岸二五六北教花堂彫刻 {Negishi 256-kita Kyōkadō chōkoku}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series of upright diptychs
title: Kintarō Snaring a Giant Carp
